event.title: 1884, all the land had been leased

data.event: The area around Dover was ideal for cattle grazing, By 1884, all the land had been leased to cattlemen.

event.title: was opened for settlement by the Land Run of 1889

data.event: The land was opened for settlement by the Land Run of 1889, and the trading post was well-placed to benefit from the farmers that settled nearby.

event.title: built a track through the Traders' Ranch and constructed abridge across the Canadian in October, 1889

data.event: The Rock Island built a track through the Traders' Ranch and constructed abridge across the Canadian in October, 1889.
In 1890, a post office designated "Dover" was established, and the community took that name.

event.title: September 18, 1906, a bridge across the Cimarron River near Dover collapsed

data.event: On September 18, 1906, a bridge across the Cimarron River near Dover collapsed beneath a Rock Island train bound for Fort Worth, Texas from Chicago.
